inn1.comm: starts off with a very wide delivery outside off, the keeper takes it knee high
back of length angling in to the batsman, Watson defends off the front foot
similar delivery a touch outside off, it is pushed towards cover off the front foot
slight width outside off and Watson steers it through gully. The third man is standing a bit square and they come back for the second easily
fuller length outside off, Watson sends it back through mid-off with a supremely-timed off-drive
length ball on off, it is timed towards mid-off again. A couple of meters straighter and this would have gone to the boundary too
angles the length ball on to the middle stump and Watson takes a forward stride but flicks it to deep backward square leg
length ball, shapes away from the right-hander after pitching on a length, left alone easily
good wheels by Russell, bowls it just short of length outside off, and gets good bounce off the surface, left alone
fuller delivery, Watson goes for the drive but hits it straight to that short-cover fielder, captain Sammy there
back of length delivery angling in from wide off crease, Watson comes forward and drives it on the up towards mid-off
gets some width outside with a short of length delivery, Watson had his front foot out but cuts it powerfully through point.
back of length angling in towards the off stump, Finch, unlike Watson, goes to the backfoot to defend that to mid-on
he has been hit on the pads and the bowler cries out an appeal! Length ball on off stump, came a touch in but it took a faint inside edge to the pads
back of length delivery, gets up on the batsman who dabs it towards square leg off the back foot
comes on the front foot and drives the length delivery on the up towards mid-off, not much timing there at all
length on the pads and he times his flick superbly, but straight to the man at square leg
he bowls it short of length just outside off stump, Finch comes forward and defends it towards mid-off
no outswing anymore for Russell, it is short of length outside off, Watson gets on top and steers it to third man
on to the pads, 146 ks, half-volley really and Finch sends it scurrying along the surface in front of square on the leg side
pulls the length back immediately, on off stump, Finch has to hop to defend that back to the bowler
another back of length delivery, defended back to the bowler
back of length delivery angling in, flicked away past square leg easily
defended back to the bowler off a back of a length delivery on off stump
quick length ball on off stump, the batsman goes on the back foot and defends towards mid-on
now he comes forwards and defends that length delivery off the front foot
angled into Watson from wide off the crease, good pace there, around 146 ks, Watson defends it off his hips towards square leg
back of length delivery outside off stump, the batsman stays back and cuts it from close to his body, down to third man
he gets squared up as he tries to defends the length delivery on off stump, plays it towards cover
back of length delivery on off stump, defended towards the leg side off back foot
oye! superbly timed down the ground. He has been coming forward all day, and this time he gets a length delivery on the middle stump, and he drives it past the non-striker beautifully
back of length around off stump, he stays in the crease and chops it down to third-man
back of length on off stump, Finch gets up on his toes and pushes the ball back to the bowler
he gets a second boundary as the ball goes through the square leg fielder. That flick should have been stopped..
attempts a bouncer but there is not much pace on that, that has been swatted away over the square leg fielder off the middle of the bat
and the square leg fielder is under fire again, he stops this time though. Finch gets up on his toes and flicks the short of length delivery straight to him
he goes to the back foot and defends the back of length delivery on off to the short cover fielder
super again, It's a 145 k bolt on the pads, and Watson drives it through midwicket off the front foot
short of length on the body, doesn't get too high and the batsman easily steers it to third man
length ball on off stump, 147 ks, it angles in towards off stump and Finch defends from the crease
goes back to the length ball and gets it past square leg off the inside-half of his bat
gets it past the diving point fielder for a couple. It was a quick short of length delivery on off, the batsman has to jump on his toes, but he manages to get enough timing in his push
bowls back of length on off stump, the batsman gets on the back foot and defends to mid-on
keeps it tight with just short of length on off stump, punched back to the bowler off the back foot
more of the same, it's hit back to the bowler, but he ricochets it wide of mid-on and the batsmen take a single
he comes on the front foot no matter what the length, defends it towards point
now he goes on the back foot and punches the back of length delivery to mid-off
good start from Sammy as he keeps it accurate on off and middle stump, defended towards the leg side
oh how well is that played! the ball was not that short and it was outside off, but the batsman waits for it and short-arm jabs it through midwicket
back of length on off stump, defended towards mid-on
lucky lucky! Short of length, he tries to flick it towards the leg side, gets a healthy leading edge and it drops between Sammy at shot cover and the man at cover..
back of length outside off, cut to third man
gets some width outside off and he opens the face to run it down to third man
short of length outside off, gets some bounce and the batsman leaves it alone
that's what happens when the keeper stands up, Watson edges his cut and it runs down to the boundary.
short of length on off stump, he goes back and defends towards the off side
appeals for lbw, but it hit the batsman on the thigh pad. the ball cut in after pitching short of length and beat the inside edge.
back of length on the off and middle line, turned to deep square leg off the back foot
he gets up on his toes and defends the length ball to midwicket
short of length, but it strays down the leg side and the batsman goes back, glances it to the left of short-fine for a boundary. good placement there.
slower delivery wide outside off by Dwayne, the batsman pushes it to point off the front foot
fuller delivery on off stump, pushed towards mid-on with soft hands and the batsmen run a single
the foot saves the boundary at deep point. It was cut hard past point and Russell sticks his boot out and saves the runs.
here comes the heave to the leg side, but it was a slower ball and it messes up with his timing, it goes over midwicket, but the deep square leg fielder fields
oh wow! Comes forward so early and punches it straight past non-striker. The fielder from long-off runs around and keeps the batsmen to two
goes forward again and pushes the length delivery to the deep cover fielder
length ball a touch outside off, the batsman stays in the crease and chops it down from very close to his body, down to third man
back of length on off stump, the batsman gets right behind it and defends it to the leg side
back of length, but a touch outside off, Finch stays in the crease and opens the face right at the end to run it down fine on the off side
this time he cuts it off the back foot, but straight down to third-man
he comes forward and defends the length ball on off
hammered! he has had enough off Vivek's comment. Stays in the crease and slams this length ball on off over midwicket for a fast, flat boundary
flight, wide outside off, up to the batsman, it's driven hard to deep cover and it gets there in no time
flatter delivery on the middle stump, tucked away to deep backward square for a single
flatter delivery outside off, turns in to the batsman, he cuts it hard, but straight to point
waits for the ball to turn in and pushes it past midwicket for a single
slower, tossed up delivery outside off, the batsman has to come right forward to defend that
width, length is short, invitation to hit, Watson cuts it hard and past the diving point fielder
it is on just short of length, but it's on the middle stump line, nudged to deep square leg off the back foot
slightly outside off, but that is enough for Watson to open the face and steer it down to third man
similar delivery, this time to Finch, who cuts it to the right of third-man and gets back for a couple
and again, this one goes a bit quicker to the fielder and that keeps the batsmen to a single
length ball angling in at 123 ks, it's defended off the front foot from around off stump line
slower delivery, 100 ks, and it was on the pads, but the batsman is beaten by the pace and gets hit on the pads as he tries to glance it
tossed up wide outside off, the batsman comes forward and drives it to deep cover
tossed up outside off stump, the batsman takes a massive forward stride and defends
pushed through outside off stump, more front foot defence
gives it some flight on off stump, the batsman stays in the crease and plays it to midwicket
goes on the backfoot to the flatter delivery and pushes it back to the bowler
turning in from around off stump, the batsman whips it off the back foot to deep square leg
length ball on off, pushed to mid-off off the front foot
he answers the detractors with a fifty straightaway with and easy steer to third-man

oh no! Finch is not able to answer his detractors as he falls early again. It was a length ball outside off and he tries to play it towards third man - he has been doing it all morning - but it was too close. the ball kisses the edge and disappears in Thomas' gloves. Darren Sammy and Ben K worked him out..
angled across the left-hander at 122ks, left alone
oh! he has overstepped, but Hughes edged it in the air past gully. And the replay shows that is a super harsh-call for the no-ball
full-toss and another no-ball for height this time. It is swatted away over square leg for a one-bounced four
fuller length ball on middle stump, Watson doesn't get hold of it and ends up chipping it to long-off
back of length outside off stump, Hughes stays on the back foot and defends it to the off side
tossed up outside off, it is slightly short in length and that allows Watson to go back and drag it to long-on
flighted on the middle and off line, pushed to long-on off the front foot
flatter delivery on off and middle, turns in a bit, the batsman works it to deep backward square leg area
flighted on leg stump, spins in a touch, defended towards off side
he comes forward and pushes the tossed up delivery to cover
pushed through on off stump, Hughes takes a big stride and defends
length ball on the middle stump line, tucked away to deep square leg off the front foot
length ball angling across the left-hander, Hughes comes forward and pushes it to cover
stays on the back foot and cuts the short of length delivery from close to his body, straight to point
keeps it tight round about the off stump line, defended off the back foot, back to the bowler
goes back to cut, but the length is not that short and he chops it on the off side
back of length on off, Hughes goes on the back foot and pushes it to cover point
flatter delivery, turning in from outside off stump, pushed towards midwicket
he stays in the crease and turns this down to deep backward square leg
he comes forward to defends but gets hit on the shoulder of the bat, it goes safely to the off side
comes to the front foot and defends to cover
slightly wider delivery, defended towards point off the front foot
it is bowled flat and goes the other way after pitching, the batsman goes on the back foot and drops it close to the leg side, the keeper gets there quickly to prevent the single
full delivery, but it's on the pads and is easily flicked to deep square leg for a single
inside edge as the batsman doesn't come forward to a length ball, he chops it on to his pads
comes forward and pushes the length ball outside off to mid-off
a good shot for just a single. Hughes comes forward and drives the ball through off side, off the front foot, but there is a fielder in the deep
another inside edge as Watson tries to defend off the front foot, it goes past the leg stump towards the keeper
pitched up a bit fuller, Watson is already on the front foot and plays the pick-up shot towards deep square leg, it goes to the fielder in the deep after one bounce
slightly shorter delivery and Watson is quick to pounce on that as he plays towards midwicket, but Pollard makes a good stop
slightly outside off and the batsman cuts it to the right of point for a single
he drives the flighted delivery outside off, in the air through cover
flatter delivery, Watson goes for a late cut but is not in control of that shot at all, it goes past the first slip and runs down to the boundary
flighted and full, it's on the middle and leg line and it's flicked away to deep square leg
works it to wide mid-on against the spin, he went back and used a lot of wrist in that shot
back of length outside off, played towards point off the back foot
length ball on off stump, pushed to mid-on off the front foot
it swings away from the batsman, but it's too wide, Hughes goes for the booming drive and hits it straight to deep cover
length ball on off stump, Watson comes forward and punches it to cover
slower delivery, 98 ks, Watson was going for the heave towards midwicket, but ends up dragging it towards deep square leg
back of length delivery, angling in from round the stumps, pushed to point off the back foot
flatter delivery on middle  stump, pushed to midwicket off the back foot
flighted delivery on off, defended towards the leg side off the front foot
tossed up fuller to the batsman, Watson drives it down to long-on
flighted around off stump, Hughes comes forward and pushes it to cover
dropped at slip. He didn't even get a hand to that. Hughes went back to a flatter delivery and   tried to cut, the edge flew low to the right of Sammy, who was a touch late to go for that..
flatter delivery on the middle stump, he defends it to midwicket off the front foot
back of length on off stump, the batsman goes on the back foot and defends it to leg side
length ball just outside off, the batsman stays in the crease and runs it to point
slower delivery, it's full on the off stump, Hughes whips a drive towards midwicket, but Sarwan cuts it with a dive
walks forward as he defends the length ball to the off side
waits for the short of length delivery to come to him, then he opens the face to run it down to third man
he stays in the crease and chops the length delivery outside off to third man for a single
quicker delivery on the off stump, driven straight to midwicket
slows it down with a flighted delivery on off stump, defended off the front foot
allows the ball to spin in to him, and dabs it towards square leg with soft hands and takes a couple
and similar shot again, he played that softly and perfectly placed it in the gap around square leg
goes down on his knee premeditatedly and picks up the flighted delivery from around middle fine to the leg side
flatter delivery on the middle, Watson bends down and flat-bats it to deep backward square leg
length ball with a lot of width, cracked towards point, but Pollard gets a good hand to hit and parries that to deep cover
pressure pressure..It was a length ball wide outside off, Hughes gives it an uncharacteristic swing, and it just drops over mid-on and rolls on to the boundary
length ball on off stump, this time he stays in the crease and pushes it to cover
he moves outside off and turns the length ball to square leg for a single
length ball, wide outside off, Watson is on the front foot and he crashes it straight to deep cover
short ball outside off, Hughes rolls his wrist as he plays that pull to deep midwicket
it is short and it is wide, any batsman is going to cut it past point and Hughes does the same
very slow and on off stump, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to point
now he defends it to midwicket off the front foot
flicked to the leg side and Sammy at midwicket dives, but can't prevent the single
76 ks, very slow, Watson comes forward and defends
length ball on the pads, pushed away towards wide mid-on for a single
full delivery on the pads, it's flicked easily to deep backward square leg
super drive! gets a full and wide delivery and Watson doesn't believe in caressing the ball, he cracks it with some power through extra cover
attempts it again, but the bat rotates in his hand this time as the ball was slightly slower, it goes back to the bowler
back of length delivery on off stump, defended to the leg side
length ball outside off, the batsman waits for it and runs it down to third man for a single
quicker delivery and Watson gets hurried in his sweep shot, still manages to play it towards deep square leg
flatter and quicker on the off stump line, turned to square leg for a single
slower now, he comes down and sweeps it straight to short fine
plays it with the turns to deep backward square leg
quicker delivery on the pads, the batsmen take a single to Sammy at midwicket. He didn't pick it up clean. the keeper shrieks..
flighted on off, Watson comes down the crease and drives it down to long on
short of length on off stump, Watson cuts it hard to deep point. Narine runs around from third-man and he had enough time to pick it up, but he chooses to stick his foot out and fails horribly...
pushed to cover off the front foot off a length ball
drives it well off a length ball, but it's hit straight to mid-off
length ball a touch outside off, Watson comes forward and pushes it to cover
slower ball wide outside off, the batsman tries to drive it square, but ends up playing that straight to point
short of length on off stump, he pushes it to wide mid-on off the front foot and takes the single to keep strike
flighted on the pads, he sweeps it in the air, but safely down to deep backward square leg
very slow, with some width outside off, Hughes cuts it but straight to point
flicked to deep square leg and there is hesitation for the second, the throw comes to the bowler at the wrong end..
takes a couple of steps down the crease and drives it to long-on
quicker 100k delivery down the leg side, Thomas does well to get hands to it
quicker outside off and Hughes fails to pierce the gap at point again
full and tossed up outside off, he comes forward and drives, but straight to cover this time
back of length outside off, the batsman stays back and steers it down to third man
full delivery on off stump, crashed off the front foot, but straight to cover
turns the delivery on the middle stump to wide long-on with a wristy push
length delivery on the pads, it's turned down to deep backward square leg. Welcome back Shane Watson...Hundred no. 7 for him
back of length outside off, steered down to third-man for a single
ugly ugly, it goes through the fielder at cover point. Pollard it is. It was driven on the up straight to him and it runs away to the boundary
the bigger boundary at deep midwicket keeps the ball in. He waited for the slow ball and slammed it deep, but the fielder got to it easily
gets his 100th six, the pace helped a bit and he picked it over deep midwicket with his favourite slog sweep
it is slow on the middle, he shapes to play aggressively but defends it the end
swings his bat again, but ends up driving it to long-on
he gets a short and wide delivery outside off, this time he puts it in the gap at point and gets a boundary
flighted on the pads, driven down to long-on easily
on the middle stump line, whipped to deep square leg off the back foot
long long long way this one has gone! He has switches gears now. Length delivery on off stump and he swings it over long on easily
fuller on off, he doesn't get a lot behind it, but it is enough to take it to the straight boundary after a couple of bounces
short and slow, he has to wait for it, but he pulls it down to deep square leg where Pollard makes a good diving stop

caught at deep backward square leg! He wasn't really going to stop after his hundred. It was a short and fast delivery on the body, Watson goes for a hook shot but it goes straight to Pollard at the boundary..
back of length on the middle and leg, Hughes glances it fine past the short fine leg for another boundary
length ball wide outside off, driven on the up to cover
slightly slower on off stump, defended towards the leg side by the batsman
back of length on the off stump, Clarke pushes it towards square leg and calls for a quick single
slower length delivery on middle stump, defended towards leg and Clarke is sent back in time as Polly gets there to the ball with two giant leaps
a touch fuller on off stump, whipped through midwicket for a single
slower delivery on the middle and leg, hits the pads as the batsman is unable to get it away
turns the length ball on the middle stump straight to short fine leg
down the leg side and Hughes gets some bat on it, just enough to beat the short fine fielder and it runs away to the boundary
short of length outside off, the batsman stays on the back foot and opens the face to run it down to third-man
length delivery on off stump, the batsman comes forward and drives it to mid-on, on the up
crashes the length ball outside off, straight back towards the bowlers, or it looks that way, but then he didn't time it that well and it goes only as far as mid-on
length ball on off stump, run down to third man for another single
length ball on off stump, he comes to the front foot and eases it through cover for a single
one bounce, two bounce, four, straight over the bowler's head. It was a full delivery and Clarke just went with the swing
back of length delivery on off stump, a leading edge almost carries to to mid-on

Clarke sees length and goes across the line straight away, but it was a slower delivery and he completely misses it. gets hit infront of off stump (maybe). The umpire says not out but Pollard calls for the review immediately. The only thing that could have saved Clarke was an inside edge. DRS says the batsman is hit just outside the line and so the decision stays..Reprieve for Clarke, but that was a bad shot
length ball wide outside off, driven on the up to mid-off
length ball angling across the batsman, cut straight to point
drives it on the up to deep cover for a single
short of length ball, it's squeezed to deep point off the back foot and Hughes, after all that concern from our feedbackers, makes it to his half-century. [Applause]
short of length delivery on off stump, it is turned towards midwicket off the front foot for a single
short of length ball on off stump, Hughes tries to pull it, but gets it as far as midwicket
and here comes the big shot, length ball on the middle, he gives it mighty thwack and sends it soaring over deep midwicket boundary into the crowd
makes room and drives the length delivery outside off to long-off
full delivery outside off, Hughes drives, but straight to cover
short of length outside off, chopped to short third-man for a single
comes down the track and chips it down the long on
length ball on the middle stump, pushed to deep midwicket with soft hands and they are back for a couple
slower and fuller outside off, driven down to long-off for a single
length ball on off stump, Clarke whips it to deep midwicket and calls for another couple
bowls it very wide outside off
quicker delivery outside off, turns away a bit, but Hughes flat bats it towards long-on
pushed through on the middle stump line, tucked away to deep square leg
flighted outside off, Hughes square drives, but straight to point
beaten outside off with a quicker one as Hughes goes for a cut
flighted outside off, turns away, it's cut straight to point
fuller and quicker on off, Hughes is late on it and ends up pushing it back to the bowler
driven in the air to wide long-on of a pitched up delivery on off, they take a couple easily
fuller delivery outside off, driven hard, but Polly bends down to make a good stop
short of length slower ball, Clarke goes for the pull but inside edges the ball to the box. He goes down on his haunches for a while.. He needs air. He is ok now

oh how well is that done! Good juggling act. Ok, so it was a low full-toss outside off, Clarke went for a heave back straight back towards the bowler but gets a toe-end to that shot. Polly jumps up assuming the ball is coming at super sonic speeds towards him, but it was a mistimed shot, comes much slower. Polly gets a palm to it and luckily for him, it falls forward and he completes a good catch
length ball on the middle stump line, pushed to long-on for a single
slower ball on the middle stump line, pushed to cover
flatter delivery outside off, a touch short, the batsman goes back and runs it to backward point
punched to long-off off the back foot for a single
tossed up outside off and Hughes gives it a good slog-swept thwack to deep midwicket boundary
beats him with a ball that turns and bounces wide outside off
fuller delivery on off, it's swept hard and in the air, but falls short of the deep square leg fielder
full and on the middle, it is turned past square leg with soft hands and they scurry back for a couple
short and wide outside off, it's cut hard through backward point
fuller length on off stump, driven down to long-on for a single
slower delivery on off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
length ball on off stump, he stays in the crease and pushes it down to long-off
slower delivery outside off, pushed to point off the front foot
on the pads, and it is flicked past short fine leg for a boundary
slower delivery wide of off, he stays in the crease and drives it through point, picks up the spot to perfection
fuller delivery, slower too, driven down the ground to long-off
makes room and cracks the short of length delivery to deep cover
misses out as he goes for a square drive to a delivery wide outside off, but gets beaten by the slowness
comes forward and drives it to deep cover for a single
slower delivery on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short of length delivery, cut hard as Hughes make room, but it's hit straight to point. He doesn't stop it cleanly so they run a single
makes room and chops the length ball on off  to deep point
slower delivery and it's full outside off, this time he goes through cover rather than point and gets tremendous power behind that
gets beaten by the slower ball as he goes for a pull
short of length outside off, it is pushed to cover off the back foot for a single
stays in the crease and drives the length delivery through to deep cover for a single
picks it off a length and slog sweeps it towards deep square leg where Pollard leaps and gets to the ball, but is not able to prevent the boundary
it's full on the off stump and Bailey misses the shot, Thomas who is standing up, gets hit on the gloves
he is edged it! And Thomas, standing up to Sammy does well as the ball sticks between his legs. It was a slower ball outside off and Hughes went for a big drive, edges it and walks off straight away
slower ball on the off stump, he comes forward and pushed it to deep midwicket for a single

short of length delivery on off, whipped away to the leg side and the batsmen call for a double. The throw from deep comes in hard and flat, but Thomas, who has hurt his finger two balls ago, is slow to take the bails off. he hold his hand in pain, but he has just allowed the batsman to get back in
here comes the reverse sweep, and he finds the gap at point to perfection
ooh la la! not a good time to toss it up. Bailey sees it early enough and blasts it over deep square leg for a huge six
moves way down the leg side, the ball follows him, and he manages to push it to long-on

caught at deep square leg! Excellente catch!! Wow! Pollard flies in from nowhere and plucks a sure shot six with one hand. It was slog swept very hard and it was going flat and fast towards the boundary. But Pollard times his leap superbly and sticks his hand out, when he comes down, he's got the ball in his hand.. super catch..unbelievable..
flatter delivery on the middle, tucked away past short fine leg for a single
that was the other one, but it didn't come back enough into the left-hander
gets a short ball and he swivels around to slap that to the deep backward square leg boundary
short ball, it's slower too, but the batsman who has made some room, manages to get under it and slam it over cover for another one..
that's more like it, it's a quick yorker which is squeezed out to point for a single
full delivery outside off, it's slashed to deep cover as the batsman takes his front foot out of the way
he moves outside the off stump to play the lap shot, but it's a low full toss on the middle stump, he gets a leading edge to it and it flies through where the first slip stands
it is pushed hard to wide long-on and the batsmen come back for the second
he cuts straight to point, but the batsmen take the single anyway, easily

caught at deep midwicket! And another catch by Pollard.  Another well-timed leap at the boundary. Bailey charged out of the crease and Narine pulled his length back, but the batsman goes for the pull anyway and gets a lot of bat on it.  But no one is surprised as Polly pulls off another stunner
top-edge as the batsman goes for a sweep from one outside off, the ball falls behind the keeper's head
it is on the middle stump line and it is tucked to short-fine, the batsmen take another quick run
cut straight to point of a flatter delivery, they call for a quick one
big offspinner, the batsman sweeps it with the turn straight to deep backward square leg
he backs away to the leg side, gives it a mighty heave but he is nowhere near the ball. It is a straight one which goes right through him and hits the leg stump
slower full toss and the batsman completely loses it, he swings his bat and makes no contact
this time it's a quicker delivery outside off, short of length, Mitchell goes for the pull but makes no contact
slower ball on the middle stump, this time Mitchell Johnson gets some bat on it as he goes down to play the paddle shot. Boundary to fine leg
makes room by moving on the leg side and tried to chip the full, slow delivery over off, but gets a leading edge to the leg side. there is no one around midwicket, so they come back for two
length ball on off stump, it's in the batsman's swing and he smashes it down to long-on and makes it two runs comfortably

inn2.comm: short of length delivery outside off, goes away with the angle and doesn't bounce much, beats the bat
length ball on off stump, he leans forward and drives it to cover
fuller length delivery on the pads, gets some swing in to the batsman, driven straight to midwicket
length ball on off stump, he comes forward and drives it down to mid-off
back of length delivery, angling across, pushed to cover off the back foot
length delivery a touch outside off is left alone by the batsman
short of length, goes across Thomas a touch outside off, left alone easily
this one comes back after pitching on off stump, not too much though, but it hits the inside edge as the batsman comes forward to defend
length ball on off stump, it is driven to cover where the two converging fielders - Bailey and Faulkner - end up in a collision.
length ball outside off, not much movement but he gets good bounce, left alone by the batsman
fuller length delivery on the pads, punched to mid-on from the crease
back of a length delivery outside off, 147 ks, comes in with the angle, hits the inside edge and then on to the pads
bowls short of length on the middle and leg line, tucked away to square leg
goes fuller with the length, it is just outside off and Thomas drives it to mid-on
length ball, swings in to the batsman a little and beats the pad to hit the pad. It was pitched outside leg though
back of length on the off stump, the batsman gets right behind the ball to defend it to the leg side
short of length delivery, 148 ks, goes across the right-hander, Thomas drops his wrists out of the way
length ball on off stump, he comes forward and pushes it to cover

length ball on off stump, Powell crashes it through the cover without really getting close to the ball, the fielder at cover runs after it, makes a valiant attempt, but is not able to prevent the boundary
back of length delivery on off stump, defended off the back foot
it's on a length and it comes in with the angle on the middle stump line, Powell this time waits in the crease and flicks it to deep backward square leg boundary
length delivery on the middle, he looks for that flick again but misses out, as he get and edge on to his pads
length delivery on off stump, defended off the front foot to midwicket
back of length on the off stump, he hops and drops it towards point and takes off for a quick run. Thomas makes it to the striker's end in time
full delivery on the pads, it is easily flicked over backward square leg for another boundary
back of length outside off, the batsman waits for it and opens the face to run it down to third man
beats him outside off with an angled delivery wide of off, Thomas goes poking and misses
gets width and it's pitched up too, he doesn't get too far forward but slices it over cover point for a boundary
back of length on the leg stump line, the batsman gets squared up as he tries to defend that of the back foot
back of length delivery, angling across the right-hander, left alone easily
back of length delivery outside off, the batsman comes forward and steers it to third-man with ease
145 ks, back of length delivery, Thomas chooses the wrong option to duck, but it wasn't that short and he gets hit on his hands..Takes a leg-bye
back of length delivery on off stump, defended to the off side off the back foot
back of length delivery, angling in to the batsman, Powell stands tall and defends towards midwicket
length ball on off and middle stump, the batsman goes for an airy drive through the on side and finds the gap between mid-on and midwicket
short of length delivery, Powell drops it towards third man with soft hands and comes back for a double. It is big big no-ball too
moves the front leg out of the way and drives the length ball on off stump down the ground past mid-off
bowls length delivery on the off stump, defended down the pitch
he picks up the length ball on off stump and whacks it down to deep midwicket boundary, it just bounces inside the boundary
goes over the bowler's head but doesn't get any timing, the fielder hits the stumps and the batsmen take an extra on the rebound
comes forward and defends that length ball on off solidly
slower ball on off stump, he waits for it and opens the face to place it to the left of point
another slower ball on off, there is not slip, no third-man, and Powell manages to guide it between the keeper and the fielder at short third-man
starts off with a back of length delivery on off stump, punched to the right of mid-on for a single
beats the batsman with one which just cuts away a bit after pitching as Thomas tries to defend
length ball on the pads and it's punched over midwicket with some power, flies to the boundary
a push to the right of mid-off off a length delivery yields another single
slower ball, a faster legspinner really, the batsman waits and punches it to point, where Maxwell allows the ball to go through him. Then he runs and pulls the ball back from the boundary with a dive
lots of doubles on this ground as the outfield is fairly big, this time to third man
length ball on the middle stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease
slower delivery on the middle stump, it's punched down to long-on for a single
back of length delivery on off and middle stump line, pushed to cover off the back foot
caught at cover!  And that is the end of that. He goes for a big heave spotting that it is a slower ball, but is in no control and ends up top-edging the ball straight to cover.
length ball on off stump, pushed to cover off the front foot
gets this slower ball to bounce a touch extra, it hits the shoulder of the bat as Powell comes forward and goes towards backward square leg
length ball outside off, doesn't bounce much as it's a slower one, the batsman misses
another back of the hand delivery, this time on off stump, it's pushed to midwicket
and more of the slower stuff from JF, pushed to cover by Powell
and more, 109,4 ks, but this was on short of length on off stump, defended off the back foot
and another one, he is becoming more of spinner now, left alone outside off
gets beaten with another slower ball outside off, bounces a touch extra and goes past the outside edge
back of length on off stump, Bravo pushes it to point off the back foot
length delivery on off stump, he comes forward and drives it on the up to cover
slower delivery on off stump, he waits on the front foot and defends towards off
110 ks, he is bowling slower after slower after slower ball, another one on off this time, defended off the front foot
more of the conventional pace, the batsman tennis-forehands it over mid-on without much timing
length ball on off, it is pushed to the gap at cover for a single
back of length outside off stump, he stands tall on the back foot and steers it down to third man
length delivery outside off stump, the batsman comes forward and leaves it alone
another slower ball outside off, it spins past the bat as Bravo comes forward to push it to off
it is a touch fuller and Lara squeezes it to point with some flair
fuller length on the middle stump line, punched straight down to the right of mid-on
back of length delivery, tight on the off stump line, pushed to point off the back foot
flights this one down the leg side, good take by Wade
flatter delivery on the pads, he misses his shot and gets hit on the pad
this time he moves a little across, but he ball is fired down the leg side, hits the thigh pad as the batsman misses
pushed through on off stump, the batsman pushes it to extra cover
and he hits the thigh pad again as Bravo misses his flick
slower on the off stump line, the batsman comes forward and dabs the ball on the off side and calls for a quick single
he pushes this to mid-off and calls for a quick one
back of length delivery, it is tucked to short fine and he takes off for a single, it was very tight and a direct hit at the non-striker's would have sent him back
back of length on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
another slower one on the off stump, the batsman defends it back to the bowler
he goes on the back foot and punches the slower ball outside off to deep cover
this one was bowled at the normal pace, back of length outside off and it bounces a touch extra, the batsman gets beaten on his cut
waits on the back foot and crunches the slower ball past a diving point for a couple
drifter on the middle stump, Bravo goes back and it keeps coming in to him, pushes it to cover for a single
oh beautiful shot! he comes down the pitch and hits it inside out over extra cover
pushed to cover off the front foot, bowler runs and does the fielding
he waits on the back foot and tucks the flat delivery to square leg
flighted delivery on the leg stump, the batsman misses his flick and it hits him on the pads
flatter one, on the pads, it is tucked to short fine off the back foot
length ball on off stump, the batsman stays in the crease and defends it off the back foot
back of length on off stump, he hops on to his toes and pushes it to point
back of length delivery on off again, it is dabbed to the right of point for a single
length ball wide outside off, the batsman stays on the back foot and steers it to the left of third man, on this ground, it is always a couple
back of length on off stump, the batsman goes back and turns it to midwicket for another single
gets a quick bouncer and he ducks under it, just like Lara used to..
flat delivery on the middle stump, pushed to midwicket for a single
back of length on off stump, the batsman goes back and punches it to deep cover
quicker on the middle stump, defended back to the bowler

oh that is a big wicket! Powell was looking very comfortable. He goes down on his knee to play a premeditated sweep but gets a tiny little top edge that lobs towards the leg side, not very high, not very far. But Wade is quick, runs a couple of steps and dives to complete a good catch.
fuller delivery from round the stumps, pushed down to long-on
tossed up delivery on off, pushed to mid-off by the batsman
tosses it up on off, it is driven hard to deep cover by Dwayne
full again and on the pads, it is flicked away to deep square leg for another couple
flatter delivery outside off, Lara goes on the back foot and slaps it through cover for a boundary
pushed up fuller, punched to midwicket
he goes down the leg side and is called  a wide
pushed to the leg side, to square leg
this one is on the pads to, the batsman is unable to get it away
floated outside off, Dwayne comes forward and pushes it to cover for a single
flatter, shorter, quicker, on off stump, Lara goes back and punches it to deep cover
flighted on the middle and leg stump, wristily flicks it to deep midwicket
this one turns away a touch, but the batsman comes forward and pushes it past point for a single
pushed through on off stump, defended back to the bowler
gets some width outside off, he is unable to find the gap with his steer shot, it goes straight to point
flat delivery on off stump, defended back to the bowler
on the middle stump line, tucked away to square leg for a single
he goes on the back foot and punches the flat delivery to cover
quick slider, the batsman stays on the back foot and punches it to long-off
dabbed to midwicket off the front foot for a single
tossed up and full on the pads, it's punched down the ground to long-on
pushed through on the middle, punched to extra cover off the back foot
floated on the middle stump, it is pushed to the gap at cover point
flatter on off stump, defended back to the bowler
turns down the leg side, it is tucked away to deep backward square for a single
flighted delivery on the off stump, it's too full too, Darren slams it past his brother for a boundary..
strays on the leg side, but he is unable to take advantage, straight to short fine
he cracks it off a length, inside out and over extra cover, that flies through to the boundary
pushed to cover off the front foot
slightly on the pads, turned to square leg for a single
flighted down the leg side, the batsman misses his sweep but it's called wide
tossed up further, it is driven down to the cow corner and they come back for a couple
tossed up on off, pushed to long-off for a single
on the pads, it is tucked to backward square leg for a single
drifts on to the pads, and Bravo is unable to get that away, gets rapped on the pads.
flighted on the middle stump, pushed to cover for a single
flighted and full, punched back to the bowler
shuffles around on the crease, punches the delivery around middle to deep midwicket
pushes it down the leg side, called a wide
flatter on the middle, Darren goes back and punches it to deep cover
full delivery on the pads, it is easily flicked to deep square leg for a single
full on the pads, Dwayne drives it past midwicket and gets a couple
length ball on the pads, it is tucked to the right of midwicket for a single
length ball on off stump, Darren comes forward and pushes it to mid-off
it is full and it is a touch wide of off, the batsman comes forward and carves it to deep cover
back of length on the middle and off line, he hops and pushes it to the left of point fielder
pushed through on the pads, it is dabbed to midwicket and they scamper for a single
takes a couple of steps out of the crease but ends up defending it back to the bowler
flatter on off stump, it is pushed to deep cover for a single
now Dwayne comes out of the crease, but gets hit on the pads outside off, takes a leg bye
quicker delivery on off stump, defended off the front foot
he comes out of the crease again, but the length is not there, ends up defending to the off side
width and full delivery outside off, Dwayne throws his bat at that one and slices it over point for a well-hit boundary
pushed to cover off the front foot and they call for a quick single
low full-toss on the pads, it is flicked through for a boundary behind square
it is on a length on off stump, the batsman runs it down to third-man for a single
whoaa! he does it again, that drive over extra cover is as good as anyone and he keeps doing that
back of length on the middle, pushed to midwicket and they call for a quick single.. 15 off that over..
flatter delivery on the off stump, no room, defended back down the pitch
slightly drifting on to the pads, the batman flicks it to deep square leg for a couple
comes down the pitch to the fuller ball, but gets an inside edge towards fine leg
comes forward to the flighted delivery and defends it back to the bowler
makes room and dabs the ball from outside off towards short third-man
wide and flat outside off, Darren stays back and punches it to deep cover
guess what, it is a slower delivery, on a short of length and on off stump, the batsman gets beaten by it as he was the only one who didn't guess it.
another slower one, full and wide outside off, the batsman drives it hard to deep cover
length ball on off stump, Dwayne dabs it to square leg for a single
length ball on off, it is placed beautifully as Darren plays an on the up drive, but Mitchell Johnson at the boundary makes an excellent diving save
he waits for the slower delivery to come and dabs it towards point for a single
slower ball on off stump, the batsman can't do much and plays it back to the bowler
punches the flat delivery down to long-on
gets some spin away from the bat as he bowls with a round arm action, beats the bat
and beats the batsman again with a quicker one outside off
he goes back and punches the delivery to deep cover to bring up his fifty
driven to long-on with a lot of wrist
comes down the pitch and pushes it to the left of the bowler
slower delivery on off stump, it's full too, driven to wide long-off
beautiful slower delivery, it dips on the batsman as he comes forward, then it bounces extra and hits the top of the bat near the handle
slower and more slower stuff, the batsman is unable to get it away
back of length on the pads, it's flicked to deep backward square and Johnson slips past the ball as he gets close and allows an extra run
back of length on off stump, punched to midwicket
slower ball on leg stump, dabbed to the left of midwicket and they take a quick single
floated outside off, the batsman gets an outside edge as he goes for a drive
pushed to cover with soft hands, no run

goes down the leg side, Wade appeals for a caught behind as Darren went for a sweep and Clarke calls for a review. It has touched the pad on the way, so are they going to take the wide back? It's not a wide..
flatter on the middle stump line, pushed to cover
drifting on to the pads, it hits the batsman as he is unable to flick it
slower delivery wide outside off, of all the options, Dwayne chooses to leave
another slower ball on the off stump, it comes really slow and the batsman ends up playing it back to the bowler
another slower ball and Dwayne is struggling to get them out of the square
slightly shorter slower ball, Dwayne has had enough of it and he pulls it over midwicket powerfully, just bounces inside the boundary
this time he gets one on the pads and he pierces the gap at deep backward square with another slap
faster deliver, pushed to cover off the front foot
full and veering on to the pads, it is squeezed past short fine leg for a boundary, more of an inside edge actually
full delivery with a lot of width outside off, he crashes it through square on the off side, it is cut off by deep cover
back of length on the middle stump, Dwayne hops up and dabs this to deep backward square to bring up his fifty
attempts a slower ball, but it is full toss outside off, the batsman manages to slice it to third man
full and on the pads, Darren misses the flick again. It hits the pads and goes towards point
beats the batsman with a length ball outside off. Dwayne tried to square drive it without much feet movement
length ball on off and middle stump, punched to cover off the front foot
slower ball down the leg side, it hits the pad along the way to the keeper, or something, not called a wide
length delivery on the pads, Darren tries to go leg side with his shot, but gets an inside edge on to his pads, that goes towards the off side
length ball on off stump, pushed towards midwicket

slower ball but this time it is on the perfect length for a big swing, he opens his arms and sends this soaring in the night sky, stays up for a long time and comes down in the crowd at long on. Massive
quicker one on off stump, pushed to cover from the crease
quick short of length delivery outside off beats Darren's attempted cut
angled in from wide off the crease, the batsman stands tall and drives it on the up to deep cover
back of length angling in to the right-handed Bravo, he defends it back to the bowler
length delivery, 144 kph, comes in with the angle, RH defends it to point off the back foot
full and quick on off stump, 145 kph, RH still struggling to hit it outside infield, pushes it to cover
why bowl slow when you are express! he tries it anyway and goes down the leg side

that's the way to do it! He bowls it with some venom from wide off the crease, RH plays down the wrong line and the middle stump is knocked back. That was a screamer and Dwayne was left holding his defensive pose for a while.. Supaah
slower ball on the middle stump, the batsman makes room and dabs it to point
length ball wide outside off, makes Gayle stretch for it, he pushes it to cover
again a length delivery wide of off, he is making Gayle stretch, it is pushed to point now
and a slower delivery wide of off, Gayle dabs it to point and takes a risky one
clears his front leg out and slams it over extra cover for a superb boundary
he makes room again, but JF bowls it full and wide outside off, Bravo has to stretch and he drives it to deep cover
back of length on the middle, Bravo makes room and cuts it hard, can't beat point
length ball outside off, the batsman throws is bat at that one and gets enough to just clear extra cover
slower ball, but it's full and it is smashed back to mid-off, straight to Ben Cutting, but it goes through his legs..some power behind that one
full on the pads, the batsman gets hit on his pads as he misses the flick and it runs down fine on the off side
takes a baby step forward, but Starc bowls a slower bouncer, Gayle fends it to the leg side

he makes room and screams that drive through cover. Starc bowled is full on the middle, but he errs just a bit in the length, but that is enough for Darren to smash it all along the ground to the extra cover boundary

all over sir, it's all over JF goes ballistic. He has the big wicket. It was a length ball angling in to the batsman, Gayle tried to flick it to the leg side without moving his feet, the ball sneaks through the gap between the bat and pad and crashes on to the off and middle stump..
slower ball on the middle stump line, he comes forward and defends it to off
length delivery on off stump, the batsman comes forward and pushes it to deep cover

and another one! If Gayle was big, this is even bigger at this stage! Bravo gives himself a lot of room and goes for the booming drive which has been serving him well today, but he misses a straight one. The ball crashes on to the off stump ..
wicket wicket and now a Smash through cover. It was full on off and Russell hammers this through extra cover
back of length on the middle stump line, the batsman gets behind the line and defends
back of length outside off, it is dabbed towards point for a single
145 kph, angling in from round the stumps, it is defended off the back foot
slightly slower, it's short and wide too, but the batsman is unable to connect as he has moved outside leg
whoaa!! He makes room this time and gets the ball in his half, drives it hard through cover, but there is a fielder in the deep
proper slower ball, 107k, and it was short of length, the batsman went for a massive forehand, but the ball arrived after he was through
he is now standing outside leg and he outside edges the full delivery through slips for more runs
he makes no connection to this one outside off, slightly slower
back of length on the pads, it is punched to deep backward square leg and they take a couple
on the pad again and this time he gets some timing behind that too, it looked a gentle dab but it is gone all the way to deep backward square boundary
pushed firmly to mid-on and they take a tight single
slower ball, he waits and smashes it off the back foot, but it is straight to mid-off
back of length on off stump, dabbed to short third man and they take another risky one

oh my! from nowhere again. It was a quick short one on the body, the batsman drops it on the off side and calls for a quick single. Mitchell Johnson runs a few steps towards the ball and flicks it on to the stumps, just like that. I don't think Polly was expecting that to come so quickly and he was well short of the crease
back of length delivery on off stump, it is defended off the back foot to cover
length ball outside off, the batsman 'leaves' it alone
length ball on off, he comes forward and drives it to deep cover
play and a miss by the batsman, it was a length ball outside off
back of length, he edges it to perfection, past the diving keeper for a much-needed boundary
back of length delivery angling across the right-hander, Sarwan stays on the back foot and steers it to third man
moves his front foot out and looks for the big swing, but he completely misses the slower ball, it wasn't far off from the off stump
weeee! there comes the baseball swing. Length ball on the middle, he flat bats it over long on, it barely rose over a few feet above the ground
fuller delivery, pushed straight down the ground, without timing and that gives them time to come back for two
misses the slower ball this time as he goes for a cut

he dabs it towards short third-man and takes off, Sarwan sends him back but it's too late. He gives it up completely but he fielder misses the stumps, it goes to the bowler who hits, but by that time the batsman is back
back of length angling in from round the stumps, Sarwan flat bats it over extra cover for a boundary..
short of length, aimed at the body, defended back to the bowler
another one veering into the body, it is pushed straight to midwicket
comes in to the batsman from wide off the crease, the batsman makes room, but it takes an inside edge and goes to the keeper
charges out and Johnson bowls a slower one, the batsman ends dragging it to long-on
a quick short of length delivery on the body, the batsman fends it off to third man for a single
short of length ball, it is not a slower one, he smashes it to deep midwicket off the back foot
slower delivery outside off, the batsman had already made some room and he slaps it past point
walks down a couple of steps and punches the length delivery to midwicket
slower delivery on off stump, it is steered to the gap between point and short third man for a coupe
play and a miss, it was a quicker one, the surprise delivery, and the batsman gets beaten on his attempted cut
smashes back the length delivery past the umpire, but it came off the toe of the bat and the fielder at deep gets to it easily

Crack! He moves way outside the leg stump and misses a fast length delivery angling in from round the stumps. Sarwan wanted to play it over cover, he misses and the ball hits the top of middle and leg.
length ball on the pads, stylishly flicked to fine leg for a single
length ball, he keeps it very tight around the middle stump, the batsman goes on the back foot and gets cramped for room, defends it back to the bowler
bowls it full and it goes down the leg side. Wade doesn't collect cleanly
full delivery and Sammy goes for the big drive, but gets an inside edge on to his pads
slower ball, it's full and outside off, the batsman moves outside leg and squeezes it through that gap between point and short third-man
Johnson is bowling slower ones today.. What a day! This one is outside off and cuts away a bit from the right-hander and beats the outside edge as he tries to steer that to point
quick short of length delivery on the middle and leg line, the batsman tries to pull, but gets hit on the thigh pad
short and wide, it is whacked through point off the back foot
length ball on off, he tries to go over extra cover, but ends up slicing it over cover for another one
oh wow, two runs just off a defensive push to mid-on.. Everyone is right back, they do it easily
short of length outside off, the batsman gives a mighty swing to that one but makes no connection.. real  big swing
oh no! Is that the end of the challenge! Russell gets a similar ball and tries a big flat batted swing towards midwicket but ends up top-edging. Wade runs around to short-fine and swallows that one..
woooohh! a huge hit this one. Moves his front leg out, this one goes way over the long-on boundary.. some hitting
back of length delivery on the body, it's defended back to the bowler
hits it him in the ribs!! That is painful, Another short of a length delivery, slightly slower, the batsman goes for a pull but the ball comes late and he has to take a blow
fast yorker outside off, it's jammed to the off side for a single
he moves outside the leg, but he gets a shorter one and Narine makes no connection
fuller on the middle, the batsman stays in the crease and flicks it to deep midwicket
slower ball, JF hits the off stick! No movement of  feet by Narine, he was standing outside leg anyway. He tries to drive from the crease and misses the slower ball. Faulkner's third
back of length on the body, tucked away to backward square leg for a single

Match is over! Series is decided. Thanks for coming everyone. It's full and on the middle stump, Sammy, left alone with Richard Parker on a boat, has no option but to take a plunge. He goes for a big swing and misses. Middle stump takes a beating..
